content: Some chat answers are amazing and have legit citations, some perplexing and messy and some are clean but incomplete and lack citations.\nYou decide which you prefer in the new year.
Q: ‚ÄúWhat is Google doing‚Äù\nA: Selling ads.
The Google search summary vs the actual page

query: how much should i pay for home insurance in moss beach ca
context:
With all the amazing improvements in LLMs for search, there's still so much work to do.

Query: [how much should i pay for home insurance in moss beach ca]

Context: I am trying to find it if I am getting stiffed.

To find out how the various search engines did, see üßµ

eval_parts.content: First off, Google.\n\nUnusable set of ads and useless featured snippets
Next up, Brave.\n\nRelevant links, but not really useful.
Here's you.com with a meta-answer. The LLM-search engine equivalent of content farm search results ...
Here's perplexity with a beautiful UX and a useless meta-answer.\n\nMeta-answers are coherent and vacuous answers that are not specific enough to answer the question at hand.

And here's Bing to the rescue.

Realizes that there's no good answers on the Internets, and instead shows a local listing onebox.

Bravo!

...a friend and I were chatting about Databricks last week, and we searched "databricks series b valuation" in order to figure out what their Series B valuation was. Unfortunately, Google doesn't understand what "series b" means (it seems to confuse "b" and "billions"), so the first search result is irrelevant. I don't even get any information about their Series B until below the fold!

content: Type this into your Google search bar: ‚Äúdid the hol‚Äù. And Google suggests you search for this: ‚ÄúDid the Holocaust happen?‚Äù\n\nAnd this is the answer: no. The top result is a link to stormfront.org, a neo-Nazi site and an article entitled: ‚ÄúTop 10 reasons why the Holocaust didn‚Äôt happen‚Äù. The third result is the article ‚ÄúThe Holocaust Hoax; IT NEVER HAPPENED‚Äù. The fifth is ‚Äú50 reasons why the Holocaust didn‚Äôt happen.‚Äù The seventh is a YouTube video ‚ÄúDid the Holocaust really happen?‚Äù The ninth is ‚ÄúHolocaust Against Jews is a Total Lie ‚Äì Proof.‚Äù

query: Is fighter Hindi movie a 3D movie ?
content: Page 1 vs scroll to Page 5 for a may-be-answer.\nIMO,  @perplexity_ai is beating search by becoming the answer engine.\n@wadhwa I told you so :)

query: why is pfix going down today?
context:
Another example of how search is so hard

PFIX is down from ~$74 to ~$40 today.

Query: [why is pfix going down today?]

All the search engines, including the LLM-powered ones fail.

Read on for the answer at the end of the üßµ...

eval_parts.content: you.com -- meta-answer -- sounds plausible, but not the real reason
Bing and Brave weren't great either
Finally, tried Twitter.\n\nTwitter search -- total fail.

how do i add tailwind to an existing next.js project
content:
Ok, this is really impressive

Phind, an AI / GPT search engine for developers, outputs up to date Next.js (App Router) instructions ü§Ø

https://www.phind.com/search?cache=cd846420-2be3-48e6-8e47-0f2e2d05e66e

But I did sneak back to Google for a few types of searches ‚Äî usually, when I was looking up specific people or trying to go to websites I already knew existed. For example: When I typed ‚ÄúWayback Machine‚Äù into my browser‚Äôs search bar, I was redirected to Perplexity, which spit out a paragraph-long essay about the history of the Internet Archive, the organization that maintains the Wayback Machine. I had to hunt for a small citation link to get to the Wayback Machine‚Äôs website, which is what I wanted in the first place.

content:
Where it shines

[ ... ]

I tested Perplexity on hundreds of queries, including questions about current events (‚ÄúHow did Nikki Haley do in the New Hampshire primary?‚Äù)...

query: Please tell me about the fictional star wars character Ahsoka and also explain if she is one of the most skilled Jedi of all time.
content: The answer was in the form of a short summary and a link to the source of the information, with an option to show the full search results or to summarize an answer to the question.\n\nThe summary provided correctly answered my complex question, even the part about whether the fictional character Ahsoka Tano is the most skilled Jedi of all time.

query: how long did the Friends TV show run?
content:
Brave uses its own LLMs to assess the ranked webpages and offer a summarization. This function is called the Summarizer, which users can opt out of if they wish.

The Summarizer isn‚Äôt invoked for every search, only about 17% of searches will spawn the feature.

What‚Äôs great about the Summarizer is that it links to sources.

The screenshot below has the links circled in red.

Query with Non-Visit-in-Person Intent

[ ... ]

Some queries clearly "ask" for nearby information or nearby results (e.g., businesses, organizations, other nearby places). Some queries are not asking for nearby information or nearby results. Here are some examples....
